info.title: VA Facilities
info.description:
## Background

The VA Facilities API version 1 (v1) provides information about VA facilities, including locations, addresses, phone numbers, hours of operation, and available services.

VA operates several different types of facilities. This API gives information about:
- Health facilities (vha)
- Benefits facilities (vba)
- Cemeteries (nca)
- Vet Centers (vc)

## Technical Overview

Health service data for v1 of this API is based on both real-time and historical data.

- Historical data is returned for the previous 30 days. Data is based on both pending and completed appointments for a given facility.
- Service-related data may be added, removed, or modified by an authorized individual at the data facility. These data changes are available to v1 of this API in real time.


### Authentication and Authorization

API requests are authorized through a symmetric API token provided in an HTTP header named apikey.

### Test data

Test data for the sandbox environment is only for testing the API and is not guaranteed to be up-to-date. After testing this API in sandbox, you can start the process of moving to production.

### Facility ID formats

A facility ID has the format prefix_stationNumber. The prefix is nca, vc, vba, or vha. Cemeteries may be VA national cemeteries or non-national; non-national cemeteries have the station number prefixed with an s. There are no other constraints on the format. Some facility ID examples are:
- Health: `vha_402GA`
- Benefits: `vba_539GB`
- National cemetery: `nca_063`
- Non-national cemetery: `nca_s1082`
- Vet Center: `vc_0872MVC`


### Service Ids

Services within the API are identified with a unique `serviceId` which are used by some endpoints. These identifiers will never change. To see all service ids currently active, use the `/facilities` endpoint to return a listing of all facilities in the API. The service ids can be found in the `services` section of the results


### Mobile Facilities

The mobile health facilities move regularly within a region. If a facility comes back from this API with "mobile": "true", the latitude/longitude and address could be inaccurate. To get the exact current location, please call the mobile facility number listed.

get.summary: Query facilities based on optional parameters such as location or ID.
get.description:
Query facilities with a combination of optional search parameters.

- A query with no search parameters will return all facilities in the response. 

- A query by bounding box returns all facilities within a geographic area bounded by the given positions. The ordering of the coordinate pairs may be in any order. 

- A query by latitude and longitude returns all facilities matching other given parameters, sorted by distance from that location. If either `lat` or `long` are supplied, both must be given. Providing an optional `radius` in miles to this query will narrow the scope of the returned facilities to those falling within the specified radius from that location. Radius may only be supplied if both lat and long are present.

- If one wishes to only get facilities with specific ids, simply include a comma separated list like `?facilityIds=id1,id2`. When requesting multiple facilities by ID, the API will return as many results as it can find matches for given other included parameters, omitting ids where there is no match. As per the JSON API specification, unrecognized IDs will not result in a returned error but rather simply not return a result for that ID. Clients may supply IDs up to the limit their HTTP client enforces for URI path lengths. (Usually 2048 characters.)

- Results are paginated. The default page size is 10. Pagination can be modified by specifying `page` and/or `per_page` parameters up to a maximum page size of 1000. JSON responses include pagination information in the standard JSON API  "links" and "meta" elements.

parameters.name: facilityIds
parameters.description: List of comma separated ids. When searching by multiple IDs, the API will return as many matches as it can find given any other parameters. If there isn't a match, the API will omit the ID. As per the JSON:API specification, unrecognized IDs will not result in a returned error but rather simply not return a result for that ID. Clients may supply IDs up to the limit their HTTP client enforces for URI path lengths. (Usually 2048 characters.)

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Zip code to search for facilities. More detailed zip codes can be passed in, but only the first five digits are used to determine facilities to return.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State in which to search for facilities. Except in rare cases, this is two characters.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of point to search for facilities, in WGS84 coordinate reference system. Lat + long returns all facilities matching other given parameters, sorted by distance from that location. Must be accompanied by a valid longitude.

parameters.name: long
parameters.description: Longitude of point to search for facilities, in WGS84 coordinate reference system. Lat + long returns all facilities matching other given parameters, sorted by distance from that location. Must be accompanied by a valid latitude.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Optional radial distance from specified latitude and longitude to filter facilities search in WGS84 coordinate reference system. Must be accompanied by a valid latitude and longitude.

parameters.name: bbox[]
parameters.description: Four `bbox[]` parameters, long1, lat1, long2, lat2. (WGS84 coordinate reference system)  A query by bounding box returns all facilities within a geographic area bounded by the given positions. The ordering of the coordinate pairs may be in any order.

parameters.name: visn
parameters.description: VISN search of matching facilities.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of facility location

parameters.name: services[]
parameters.description: List of services a facility offers

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: Boolean flag to include or exclude mobile facilities

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to return per paginated response.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results to return per paginated response.

example.message: No API key found in request

get.summary: Retrieve a specific facility by ID

parameters.name: facilityId
parameters.description: Facility ID, in the form `<prefix>_<station>`, where prefix is one of "vha", "vba", "nca", or "vc", for health facility, benefits, cemetery, or vet center, respectively.

400.description: Bad request - invalid or missing query parameters

example.message: No API key found in request

get.summary: Bulk download of all facility IDs
get.description: Retrieves all available facility IDs only

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Optional facility type search filter

example.message: No API key found in request

get.summary: Retrieve all VA health facilities reachable by driving within the specified time period
get.description:
Retrieve all VA health facilities that are located within a specified drive time from a specified location based on coordinates (`lat` and `long`). Optional filter parameters include `drive_time` and `services[]`. 

Results of this operation are paginated. Pagination can be modified by specifying `page` and/or `per_page` parameters. Responses include pagination information in the standard JSON API "links" and "meta" elements. 

The "attributes" element has information about the drive-time band that contains the requested location for each facility in the response. The values of `min_time` and `max_time` are in minutes. For example, a facility returned with a matched `min_time` of 10 and `max_time` of 20 is a 10 to 20 minute drive from the requested location.

To retrieve full details for nearby facilities, see the documentation for `/facilities?ids`.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the location from which drive time will be calculated.

parameters.name: long
parameters.description: Longitude of the location from which drive time will be calculated.

parameters.name: drive_time
parameters.description: Filter to only include facilities that are within the specified number of drive time minutes from the requested location.

parameters.name: services[]
parameters.description: Optional facility service search filter

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to return per paginated response.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results to return per paginated response.

example.message: No API key found in request

get.summary: Query a specific facility service using a service ID and a facility ID.
get.description:
Query facility services using service parameter. Simply provide the service like `services/cardiology`. 

Results are paginated. JSON responses include pagination information in the standard JSON API "links" and "meta" elements. 

You may optionally specify `page` and `per_page` with any query.

parameters.name: facilityId
parameters.description: Facility ID, in the form `<prefix>_<station>`, where prefix is one of "vha", "vba", "nca", or "vc", for health facility, benefits, cemetery, or vet center, respectively.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Service ID, unique identifier for service

400.description: Bad request - invalid or missing query parameters

example.message: No API key found in request

get.summary: Retrieve all services for a given facility
get.description:
Queries for services associated with a facility. Supports optional search parameters to narrow the results. By default, all services for the given facility will be returned. A search may specify a comma separated list of `service` ids to include by using the services parameter. The type of services (e.g. "health", "benefits", etc) may be specified in the `type` parameter.


Results are paginated. JSON responses include pagination information in the standard JSON API "links" and "meta" elements. 



### Parameter combinations
You may optionally specify `page` and `per_page` with any query. You can query with any combination of the following: 

- `service`

- `serviceType`

Both parameters are optional, and both may be used independently of each other or not at all.

parameters.name: facilityId
parameters.description: Facility ID, in the form `<prefix>_<station>`, where prefix is one of "vha", "vba", "nca", or "vc", for health facility, benefits, cemetery, or vet center, respectively.

parameters.name: serviceIds
parameters.description: Comma separated list of `service` ids can be used alongside or independently of `serviceType`

parameters.name: serviceType
parameters.description: Type of service can be used alongside or independently of `serviceIds`

400.description: Bad request - invalid or missing query parameters

example.message: No API key found in request

address2.description: Second line of address if applicable (such as a building number).

address3.description: Third line of address if applicable (such as a unit or suite number).

Addresses.description: Collection of addresses associated with a facility.

distance.description: Distance to facility in decimal format.

Distance.description: Distance to facility in miles using decimal format. Used when querying for facilities proximal to a location.

FacilitiesMetadata.description: Metadata representation for data in response. This metadata includes paginated items that allow user to see the current page, objects perPage, total pages and total entries.

FacilitiesResponse.description: An object describing one or more VA facilities

facilityType.description: One of facility top-level type categories (e.g.) health, benefits, cemetery and vet center.

classification.description: Subtype of facility which can further be used to describe facility.

operationalHoursSpecialInstructions.description: Additional information about a VA health or Vet Center facility's operating hours.
example: More hours are available for some services.
If you need to talk to someone, call the Vet Center at 1-877-927-8387.
Vet Center hours are dependent upon outreach assignments.

items.description: Additional information about a VA health or Vet Center facility's operating hours.
items.example: ["More hours are available for some services.","If you need to talk to someone, call the Vet Center at 1-877-927-8387.","Vet Center hours are dependent upon outreach assignments."]

Hours.description: Standard hours of operation. Currently formatted as descriptive text suitable for display, with no guarantee of a standard parseable format. Hours of operation may vary due to holidays or other events.

code.description: Status codes indicate normal hours/services, limited hours/services, closed operations, or published facility notices for visitors.

additionalInfo.description: Details of facility notices for visitors, such as messages about parking lot closures or floor visitation information.

supplementalStatus.description: List of supplemental statuses for VA facility.

OperatingStatus.description: Current status of facility operations. The overall status of the facility, which can be: Normal Hours and Services, Facility Notice, Limited Hours and/or Services, or Closed. This field replaces active_status.

related.description: Link to related pages of response.

self.description: Link to current page of response.

first.description: Link to first page of response.

prev.description: Link to previous page of response.

next.description: Link to next page of response.

last.description: Link to last page of response.

PageLinks.description: Links for first page, next page, previous and last page of response.

totalPages.description: Total number of pages matching this query.

totalEntries.description: Total number of entries matching this query.

Pagination.description: Pagination data reflecting response that has been seperated into discrete pages.

link.description: URL for an API request for parent facility

primaryCareUrgent.description: Percentage of Veterans who say they usually or always get an appointment when they need urgent attention at a primary care location. NOTE: Veterans are rating their satisfaction of getting an appointment for an urgent primary care visit, NOT an urgent care visit.

primaryCareRoutine.description: Percentage of Veterans who say they usually or always get an appointment when they need routine attention at a primary care location. NOTE: Veterans are rating their satisfaction of getting an appointment for a routine primary care visit.

specialtyCareUrgent.description: Percentage of Veterans who say they usually or always get an appointment when they need urgent attention at a specialty care location. NOTE: Veterans are rating their satisfaction of getting an appointment for an urgent specialty care visit, NOT an urgent care visit.

specialtyCareRoutine.description: Percentage of Veterans who say they usually or always get an appointment when they need routine attention at a specialty care location. NOTE: Veterans are rating their satisfaction of getting an appointment for a routine specialty care visit.

PatientSatisfaction.description: Veteran-reported satisfaction score for health care services at VA health facilities.

fax.description: Phone number used for faxing to given facility.

healthConnect.description: Phone number for VA Health Connect.

pharmacy.description: Phone number for pharmacy for given facility.

afterHours.description: Phone number that may be reached outside of operating hours for given facility.

patientAdvocate.description: Phone number for patient advocate for given facility.

mentalHealthClinic.description: Phone number for mental health clinic for given facility.

enrollmentCoordinator.description: Phone number for enrollment coordinator for given facility.

Phone.description: Collection of all telephone contact numbers for given facility.

Satisfaction.description: Scores that indicate patient satisfaction at given facility per service.

link.description: Fully qualified link for facility service.
Fully qualified link for facility service.
Fully qualified link for facility service.

health.description: List of health service objects for given facility.

benefits.description: List of benefits service objects for given facility.

other.description: List of benefits service objects for given facility.

link.description: Base services link for services at facility.

lastUpdated.description: Date of the most recent change in offered services.

Services.description: All services offered by a VA facility grouped by service type.

label.example: COVID-19 health protection guidelines: Levels low

GenericError.description: A general error json response for things like Authorization Errors or Bad Requests (ex. invalid parameter values).

bandVersion.description: Version of the drive time band data set used to generate this response.

Meta.description: Object containing metadata about this response.

Nearby.description: Object describing a nearby VA facility.

NearbyResponse.description: Object containing minimum and maximum time it takes to reach a facility.

label.description: Appointment phone number label (e.g. 'Main phone', 'Appointment phone', etc).

AppointmentPhoneNumber.description: Phone number information for scheduling an appointment.

appointmentLeadIn.description: Additional appointment information. May contain html / string formatting characters.
appointmentLeadIn.example: Your VA health care team will contact you if you're eligible to get a vaccine during this time. As the supply of vaccine increases, we'll work with our care teams to let Veterans know their options.

appointmentPhones.description: List of phone numbers related to scheduling appointments for this service.

lastUpdated.description: Date and time of most recent upload of detailed service from CMS.

path.description: URL to a page with additional details for this service within the associated facility's health care system.

DetailedService.description: Detailed information of a facility service.

buildingNameNumber.description: Building name and/or number of service.

wingFloorOrRoomNumber.description: Wing, floor, or room number of service.

emailAddress.description: Email address for facility service contact.

DetailedServiceEmailContact.description: Email contact information for facility service.

DetailedServiceHours.description: Standard hours of operation. Currently formatted as descriptive text suitable for display, with no guarantee of a standard parseable format. Hours of operation may vary due to holidays or other events.

emailContacts.description: List of email contact information regarding facility services.

additionalHoursInfo.description: Additional information related to service location hours.
additionalHoursInfo.example: Location hours times may vary depending on staff availability

referralRequired.description: String detailing if referrals are required for the service.

walkInsAccepted.description: String detailing if walk-ins are accepted for the service.

DetailedServiceLocation.description: Details for a location offering a service.

new.description: Average number of days a Veteran who hasn't been to this location has to wait for a non-urgent appointment.

established.description: Average number of days a patient who has already been to this location has to wait for a non-urgent appointment.

PatientWaitTime.description: Expected wait times for new and established patients for a given health care service at VA health facilities.

DetailedServicesMetadata.description: Object containing metadata about detailed service response

data.description: List of objects containing service details.

DetailedServicesResponse.description: An object containing a list of services.
